name: Eurogypsum
goal: Founded in 1961, Eurogypsum is a European federation of national associations of gypsum products manufacturers, based in Brussels and registered in Belgium as an AISBL (International Non-Profit Association). Its role is to promote the interests of the European Gypsum Industry and ensure that there is awareness at a European level of the contribution the Gypsum Industry makes to society in general and to the built environment in particular.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Transport
euInitiatives:
The main activities covered by the association are:

• European Green Deal and 2030 climate targets
• ‘Renovation wave’ for the building sector
• Resource efficiency in the circular economy
• 2030 biodiversity strategy
• Single market policy (Construction Products Regulation)
• Raw material supply policies
• Energy efficiency
• Emissions trading
• Just transition and tackling inequality
• Indoor air quality and a toxic-free environment
• Protecting cultural heritage
• Adapting to changing demographics
